bioghist.p: Evan Turner, an art historian and scholar, was the Director of the Museum from 1964 to 1978; from here he went to North Carolina's Ackland Art Museum and beginning in 1982, was the Director of the Cleveland Museum of Art. A dynamic personality, he reorganized the staff along individual departmental lines. The Kienbusch Arms and Armor Collection came to the Museum during his tenure and the closing and reopening of the Museum after the completed air-conditioning also took place then.

scopecontent.p: Turner's records are voluminous and wide-spread in subject matter. He was among the “inner circle” of the Association of Art Museum Directors (AAMD) and Chairman of their Professional Practices Committee. In addition, he was on the Advisory Panel of the National Council of the Arts, and the National Endowment for the Arts. There are lengthy records of his activities in these fields.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
